content: Which legendary jazz musician, known for his innovative trumpet playing and unique vocal style, recorded songs like "What a Wonderful World" and "Hello, Dolly!"?

Ah, that would be Louis Armstrong, often referred to as Satchmo. He was a real pioneer in jazz, not just for his virtuoso trumpet playing but also for his distinctive voice and style. "What a Wonderful World" and "Hello, Dolly!" are indeed among his most famous recordings. His influence on music is immeasurable, and he's one of those artists who transcended genres and time periods.
